amuse.data.io
Class ArffDataSet

java.lang.Object
  amuse.data.io.DataSetAbstract
      amuse.data.io.ArffDataSet
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractArffExperimentSet, AlgorithmTableSet, FeatureTableSet, FileTableSet, PluginTableSet
public class ArffDataSet
extends DataSetAbstract

DataSet is used to represent data vectors in Amuse and is closely related to the ARFF file format, developed by the University of Waikato.
Each DataSet has a name and a set of attributes. Each attribute corresponds to a data vector with values according to its type. All attributes have exactly the same amount of values, in other words each data vector of a DataSet has the same length.

Version:
$Id: $
Author:
Clemens Waeltken

Constructor Detail

ArffDataSet

public ArffDataSet(java.lang.String name)
The standard constructor to create a new DataSet.

Parameters:
name - The name of the new DataSet.

ArffDataSet

public ArffDataSet(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException
This constructor loads a DataSet from a given arff file. IOExceptions are thrown due to IO operations. A standart amount of 1000 lines are held in memory.

Parameters:
file - The arff file to load from.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown whenever given file is not a valid arff or not existing.

ArffDataSet

public ArffDataSet(java.io.File file,
                   int linesToCache)
            throws java.io.IOException
This constructor loads a DataSet from a given arff file. IOExceptions are thrown due to IO operations.

Parameters:
file - The arff file to load from.
linesToCache - The count of lines to hold in memory.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown whenever given file is not a valid arff or not existing.

addAmuseAttribute

public final void addAmuseAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String value)
Adds Amuse-specific metadata to this DataSet. If key already exists its value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
key - The key to store under.
value - The value to store under given key.

getAmuseAttribute

public final java.lang.String getAmuseAttribute(java.lang.String key)
                                         throws DataSetException
Returns the value of an AmuseAttribute under given key. If the key does not store any value null will be returned.

Parameters:
key - The key to lookup.
Returns:
The value at key.
Throws:
DataSetException - Thrown whenever you try to get an AmuseAttribute wich is not stored in this DataSet.
